content: Prof. Manuel Roveri – Full Professor, Politecnico di Milano (Italy) Skip to content Prof. Manuel Roveri Full Professor, Politecnico di Milano (Italy) Google Linkedin Research activities Embedded and Edge Artificial Intelligence​ Tiny Machine and Deep Learning Privacy-preserving Machine and Deep Learning Learning in presence of concept drift Education Ph.D in Computer Engineering Politecnico di Milano (Italy), 2007 MS in Computer Science University of Illinois at Chicago (USA), 2003 MS in Computer Engineering Politecnico di Milano (Italy), 2003 Academic positions Full Professor [2022-] Politecnico di Milano (Italy) Associate Professor [2015-2022] Politecnico di Milano (Italy) Visiting Researcher [2022] Imperial College London (UK) Assistant Professor [2008-2015] Politecnico di Milano (Italy) Visiting Researcher [2011] Imperial College London (UK) More info in the Bio Spotlight news (selected) Manuel Roveri received the 2021 "Outstanding Associate Editor" of the IEEE Transactions on Emerging Topics in Computational Intelligence General Co-chair of IEEE/ACM International Conference On AI-ML Systems, (AIMLSystems 2024), 8-11 October 2024, Baton Rouge, US. Keynote Talk on “Tiny Machine Learning and Edge AI” at the 2022 International Conferences on Computational Intelligence and Data Analytics (ICCIDA 2022) Technical Talk - IBM Accelerated Discovery Seminar: "Is privacy-preserving computation the next big thing in machine and deep learning?" - Feb. 2022 Instructor of the course on "Technologies and platforms for Artificial Intelligence" on Coursera offered by Politecnico di Milano
